description: Returns a list of all of the channels associated with the specified bot. The GetBotChannelAssociations operation requires permissions for the lex:GetBotChannelAssociations action.

parameters.name: botName
parameters.description: The name of the Amazon Lex bot in the association.

parameters.name: botAlias
parameters.description: An alias pointing to the specific version of the Amazon Lex bot to which this association is being made.

nested_items.name: botChannelAssociations
nested_items.description: An array of objects, one for each association, that provides information about the Amazon Lex bot and its association with the channel.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the association between the bot and the channel.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A text description of the association you are creating.

nested_items.name: botAlias
nested_items.description: An alias pointing to the specific version of the Amazon Lex bot to which this association is being made.

nested_items.name: botName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Lex bot to which this association is being made.

nested_items.name: createdDate
nested_items.description: The date that the association between the Amazon Lex bot and the channel was created.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: Specifies the type of association by indicating the type of channel being established between the Amazon Lex bot and the external messaging platform.

nested_items.name: botConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides information necessary to communicate with the messaging platform.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the bot channel.
CREATED - The channel has been created and is ready for use.
IN_PROGRESS - Channel creation is in progress.
FAILED - There was an error creating the channel. For information about the reason for the failure, see the failureReason field.

nested_items.name: failureReason
nested_items.description: If status is FAILED, Amazon Lex provides the reason that it failed to create the association.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: A pagination token that fetches the next page of associations. If the response to this call is truncated, Amazon Lex returns a pagination token in the response. To fetch the next page of associations, specify the pagination token in the next request.
